erjang
Class EInputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      java.io.ByteArrayInputStream
          erjang.EInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
public class EInputStream
extends java.io.ByteArrayInputStream

Provides a stream for decoding Erlang terms from external format.

Note that this class is not synchronized, if you need synchronization you must provide it yourself.

getPos

public int getPos()
Get the current position in the stream.

Returns:
the current position in the stream.

setPos

public int setPos(int pos)
Set the current position in the stream.

Parameters:
pos - the position to move to in the stream. If pos indicates a position beyond the end of the stream, the position is move to the end of the stream instead. If pos is negative, the position is moved to the beginning of the stream instead.
Returns:
the previous position in the stream.

readN

public int readN(byte[] buf)
          throws java.io.IOException
Read an array of bytes from the stream. The method reads at most buf.length bytes from the input stream.

Returns:
the number of bytes read.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the next byte cannot be read.

read_boolean

public boolean read_boolean()
                     throws java.io.IOException
Read an Erlang atom from the stream and interpret the value as a boolean.

Returns:
true if the atom at the current position in the stream contains the value 'true' (ignoring case), false otherwise.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the next term in the stream is not an atom.

read_atom

public EAtom read_atom()
                throws java.io.IOException
Read an Erlang atom from the stream.

Returns:
a String containing the value of the atom.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the next term in the stream is not an atom.

read_bitstr

public byte[] read_bitstr(int[] pad_bits)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Read an Erlang bitstr from the stream.

Parameters:
pad_bits - an int array whose first element will be set to the number of pad bits in the last byte.
Returns:
a byte array containing the value of the bitstr.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the next term in the stream is not a bitstr.
